intro: Actinodaphne stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf camphor tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, glossy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically dark red when mature, containing several seeds. Its bark and leaves contain essential oils, which have been used traditionally for their medicinal and aromatic properties. Actinodaphne stenophylla is often found in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
